text: have you ever wondered if you or someone
you love is autistic an estimated 60% of
those on the autism spectrum are
undiagnosed leaving them without
understanding or support and at a higher
risk of depression anxiety and suicide
in one of our previous videos we talked
about things that autistic people wanted
you to know but what if you could also
be autistic in scientific surveys many
autistic adults report common
experiences in their younger years that
can guide others on their Journey here
are five signs you are an undiagnosed
autistic adult but don't know it written
by our autistic specialist writer
disclaimer although this list is based
on scientific research it is not a
substitute for professional diagnosis
please see a psychological professional
if you are interested in exploring an
Autism
diagnosis number one you always knew you
were different but didn't know why
imagine this you are 8 years old and
trying to impress the other kids in the
playground by identifying the leaves
this one's a conifer you can tell by the
clusters of needles you see nods of
approval this one's an aspen you can
tell by the round leaf and flat petal
you hear an exaggerated wow followed by
barely concealed titters before you can
figure out if they are being sarcastic
everyone bursts out laughing and walks
away from you leaving you alone
bewildered and understanding only one
thing other kids don't talk about leaves
does this sound familiar autistic adult
report that before their diagnosis they
always knew they were different from
others but never knew why from a young
age every day brought punishing
reminders that everyone else thought
acted spoke dressed and expressed
emotions differently without any
explanation in every crowd they were
always the odd one art leaving them
feeling like an alien stranded among
earthlings without a guide have you
always felt like you were the odd one
out your whole life you might be Human
After All just an autistic one
number two you sympathize with autistic
people have you ever read the biography
of an autistic person watched a new
story about an autistic person or
watched a social media video by an
autistic influencer and thought that
sounds like me was it almost as if they
were presenting your own life story even
though you thought you were one of a
kind if you feel like their stories are
your stories their thoughts are your
thoughts and their feelings are your
feelings maybe that's because they are
this deep sympathy could could be a sign
that you have found your crowd after
many years of being alienated from
everyone around you finding a single
other person with similar experiences
can be a life-changing moment and a sign
that you are also
artistic number three you sympathize
with characters with autistic traits on
the other hand do you have a deep
connection with fictional characters who
have autistic traits fictional
characters often have exaggerated quirks
that are easier to pick up on so even
characters who are not officially on the
autism Spectrum can still have traits
that are relatable to an autistic
audience before the author of this video
was diagnosed his friend once compared
his habits to those of Sheldon Cooper
from The Big Bang Theory stilted and
pedantic speech check favorite sitting
spots check adherence to strict routines
check if you feel like the autistic
character in fictional stories is the
only normal character and everyone else
are the weird ones that could be a sign
that you're also autistic number four
you are pretending to be normal how do
you respond to the pressure to fit in
autistic adults often feel that Society
is unforgiving about the normal traits
and unspoken Norms that everyone else
takes for granted make eye contact but
not too much make small talk but only
about the right topics be honest but not
too honest if these don't come naturally
to you and you are constantly pretending
to be normal you might be mking this is
when autistic people Force themselves to
consciously imitate normal behavior like
following a script even at the risk of
great stress exhaustion and self-doubt
even worse nobody gives you a guide on
how to do it if you feel like it's a
constant struggle to appear normal to
others to gain acceptance you might be
masking like other autistic people
number five you research autism
compulsively is this the first autism
related video you clicked on if you are
autistic then chances are that it's just
one part of the autistic rabbit hole
that you've borrowed deeply into many
autistic adults adults report that when
they first heard of autism they passed a
Tipping Point in their life every detail
seemed to match their lifelong search
for ansers about why they were so
different from others so they researched
it compulsively through endless articles
books movies websites and contacting
other autistic people until they
identified themselves as autistic and
sought a diagnosis if this sounds like
the journey you are on then maybe this
video is the Tipping Point for you so
there you have it five signs you are an
UND diagnosed autistic adult but don't
know it if you feel like you are
different from others sympathize with
autistic people and characters are
always pretending to be normal and
research autism compulsively then you
might want to consider seeking a
diagnosis this can be a key step to
understanding self-acceptance and
support if you're interested in learning
more see our other videos about autism
if this video helped you and you think
it'll help others don't forget to like
and share the studies and references
used are listed in the description below
see you next time
